title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Knicks' season is in jeopardy
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: Pacers hail Siakam as 39-point night quiets MSG
content: Behind Pascal Siakam's 39-point performance, the Pacers will head home with a 2-0 series lead after hanging on for a 114-109 win over the Knicks in Game 2.

title: Knicks frustrated as lapses on D cost them again
content: The Knicks had costly defensive breakdowns for the second straight game and acknowledged they have to "figure it out" as the series heads to Indiana for Game 3.

title: Skenes on trade chatter: 'Anybody can play GM'
content: Paul Skenes didn't hear Pirates GM Ben Cherington say that trading him to give the club an influx of position player talent is "not at all part of the conversation." When someone relayed Cherington's comments to him, the 22-year-old ace laughed.

title: Salah named Premier League Player of the Season
content: Mohamed Salah was named the Premier League Player of the Season on Saturday after the Egyptian enjoyed a stellar individual campaign.

title: MVP SGA, runner-up Jokic headline All-NBA teams
content: The five players who finished atop the MVP balloting, including winner Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and runner-up Nikola Jokic, highlighted the All-NBA teams.

title: 'Yes, we can play defense': Oilers blank Stars in G2
content: Stuart Skinner made 25 saves for his third shutout of the postseason as the Oilers beat the Stars 3-0 in Game 2 to even the Western Conference finals.

title: Braves' Acuña homers on 1st pitch after year away
content: Ronald Acuña Jr. crushed his first pitch 467 feet for a home run in his dramatic return to the Braves, almost one year after he tore his left ACL.

title: Green Bay files NCAA waiver to play in $1M TBT
content: Green Bay filed for a waiver from the NCAA to allow its men's basketball team to compete in The Basketball Tournament, the $1 million, winner-take-all summer tournament.

title: ⚾ Best player of a generation: Betts or Trout?
content: Betts is climbing the all-time WAR list the same way Trout once was. We examine the two and dive into which players similarly ruled previous eras.

title: Best surprises, worst surprises and no surprises: Takeaways from Week 1 of the WNBA
content: The Mercury's depth is better than expected, and shooting from the Sky and Valkyries has underwhelmed.

title: Panthers-Hurricanes Game 3 preview: How can Carolina climb back into the series?
content: With the Canes down in a 2-0 hole, here are the key series stats, players, matchups and betting intel to know.

title: Picking the NFL’s most underrated players: 12 names -- one at every position -- deserving of more respect
content: Who are the most underappreciated players in the NFL? We picked one at 12 different positions, including a veteran tight end.

title: Commanders hoping Deebo, Tunsil, draft picks will keep Jayden Daniels ascending
content: Washington believes veteran additions Samuel, Tunsil and draft picks at OT, WR will bring different dynamic to offense.

title: What does a lap of Monaco in a McLaren feel like? Restrained
content: Lapping the streets of Monaco, one is left with a common feeling within F1: This place is holding cars back.

title: Will Penske cheating scandal overshadow IndyCar's crown jewel?
content: Instead of celebrating a sellout crowd, IndyCar is defusing another cheating scandal ahead of the Indy 500.

title: Which NBA Finals matchup is most compelling? We're ranking all four possible series
content: No matter which two teams escape the conference finals, we're headed for a never-before-seen Finals matchup.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: How Liverpool said goodbye to a club legend and somehow won the Premier League
content: From the end of one historic era under Jürgen Klopp, Liverpool immediately began another under Arne Slot, to everyone's surprise. How did that happen?

title: The case for and against Man United keeping Ruben Amorim as manager
content: The pressure continues to build on Amorim. Let's make the arguments for keeping him and making a change.

title: Napoli edge out Inter to win 4th Serie A title
content: Napoli clinched their second Serie A title in three seasons after edging Inter Milan thanks to a 2-0 home victory over Cagliari in a dramatic finale to the season on Friday.

title: Klopp on booing TAA: So upset I turned off TV
content: Jurgen Kopp has expressed his disappointment with Liverpool fans booing Trent Alexander-Arnold after the defender announced he will leave the club this summer.

title: Napoli hero McTominay wins Serie A MVP award
content: Scott McTominay proved there's plenty of life after Manchester United, after ending his first season since leaving Old Trafford with a Serie A title and the league's MVP award.

title: Inter focus on UCL 'dream' as Serie A slips away
content: As Inter Milan came to terms with losing the Serie A title on the final day, the tea's assistant coach said they must now shift focus to the Champions League final against PSG

title: Ancelotti after Madrid exit sealed: Bond is 'eternal'
content: Carlo Ancelotti will leave Real Madrid after this weekend's final game of the LaLiga season, the club has confirmed.

title: Sources: Garnacho set for Man Utd transfer talks
content: Alejandro Garnacho is increasingly likely to leave Manchester United this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: NWSL's DeMelo reveals she has hyperthyroidism
content: Savannah DeMelo was diagnosed with Graves' disease and hyperthyroidism last fall, conditions she spoke about publicly for the first time this week with ESPN.

title: Ronaldo sells stake in Valladolid following protests
content: Brazil great Ronaldo is selling his controlling stake in Valladolid, the Spanish soccer club said on Friday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Maignan to replace Onana
content: Manchester United are targeting AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan to usurp André Onana as No. 1. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Everything you need to bet Monaco, Indy 500 and Coca-Cola 600
content: Betting guide to the biggest weekend in motorsports, with the Monaco Grand Prix, Indy 500, and Coca-Cola 600.

title: Experts weigh in: How will Djokovic and Swiatek fare? Can Alcaraz defend?
content: Alcaraz and Swiatek were last year's French Open champs, but Sinner, Gauff and many more could contend.

title: Central Funds, Water: Non-BJP Chief Ministers' Demands At Meet Led By PM
content: The Niti Aayog meeting on Saturday, in which the Prime Minister urged all states to work together towards the goal of a developed India, also saw some opposition chief ministers raise issues affecting their states, with their main grievances boiling

title: Pregnant Woman, 23, Dies At Jaipur Hospital Due To Suspected Blood Mismatch
content: A 23-year-old pregnant woman died at a Jaipur hospital, with her family claiming that she was transfused with incompatible blood.

title: Man Hung Upside Down, Thrashed In Rajasthan, "Mafia Rule", Says Congress
content: A man was hung upside down with a rope from an earthmover in Beawar district and beaten over the suspicion of cement theft, police on Saturday said.

title: "He Didn't Say He'll Leave": Muhammad Yunus' Aide Amid Resignation Buzz
content: This announcement comes two days after he told student-led National Citizen Party (NCP) leaders that he was mulling resignation as he felt "the situation is such that he cannot work".

title: British-Indian Twins Join High IQ Mensa Club For Brainiacs
content: A pair of British Indian twins have been admitted to the elite Mensa membership club of children with a high intelligence quotient (IQ) after clearing a tough set of challenges to score in the top percentile.

title: Forced To Leave Son As Collateral For Rs 25,000 Loan, Woman Finds Him In Grave
content: A duck rearer in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati and his family have been arrested for keeping a woman and her three children from a tribal community as bonded labourers, making her leave her son behind as "collateral" and then secretly burying his body.

title: Mentally Challenged Woman Dragged Off Street, Gang-Raped By Prison Guards In Assam
content: Two jail guards have been arrested in Assam's Sribhumi district for allegedly dragging a young, homeless woman, who is mentally challenged, to the compound of the district jail and gang-raping her.

title: Musk's DOGE Involvement Was 'One Of The Greatest Brand Destructions': Expert
content: On a popular podcast called Pivot, hosted by him, he said that Musk aligned himself with the wrong people and alienated Teslas customer base. Tesla was one of his most important holdings but Musks new allies - the Republicans - were not fans of EVs

title: On Camera, Zepto Delivery Agent Punches Customer Over Address Mismatch
content: A Zepto delivery executive allegedly assaulted a customer over a mismatch in address in Bengaluru earlier this week, leaving him seriously injured.

title: Provident Fund Body EPFO Retains 8.25% Interest For FY25
content: The government has ratified the rate of interest on employees' provident fund at 8.25 per cent for FY25, enabling retirement fund body EPFO to deposit the annual interest accumulation in the post-retirement funds of over 7 crore subscribers.

title: First COVID Case Reported In NCR As Woman Tests Positive In Noida
content: A 55-year-old woman from the National Capital Region has been tested positive for COVID-19, marking the first case in Uttar Pradesh's Noida amid the recent surge in cases in India, as per the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of Gautam Buddha Nagar.

title: "Bloody Corridor" Causes Churn In Bangladesh But Yunus Wants To Hang On
content: Muhammad Yunus, who heads the interim government in Bangladesh, is now aiming for a five-year term as the military pushes for elections in the Southeast Asian country where a deadly protest had led the government to collapse last year.

title: Paytm Says Top Court Stays Rs 5,712 Crore GST Notice Sent To First Games
content: The Supreme Court has granted a stay on a Rs 5,712-crore GST notice sent to fintech firm One97 Communications-owned real money gaming platform First Games, a regulatory filing said on Saturday.

title: Karnataka Minister Urges People Not To Panic Amid Rise In COVID Cases
content: Amid a gradual uptick in COVID-19 cases in Karnataka over the past few days, state Health Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao on Saturday asked people to stay calm and continue with their daily routines.

title: Seer Arrested For Kidnapping, Raping 17-Year-Old In Karnataka: Cops
content: A seer of a Ram temple in Karnataka's Belgaum district has been arrested for sexually assaulting a 17-year-old girl, said the police.

title: Tripura Zoo Witnesses Birth Of 3 Tiger Cubs For First Time In 53-Year History
content: In a landmark moment for wildlife conservation in Tripura, the Sepahijala Zoo and Wildlife Sanctuary has witnessed the birth of three tiger cubs-marking the first time in its 53-year history that such an event has occurred.

title: 'Important, Optimistic It'll Be Functional Soon': Union Minister On Sikkim Airport
content: Taking a keen interest in the airport at Pakyong, which serves Sikkim's capital Gangtok and has seen no flight operations for nearly two years, Union Minister Pabitra Margherita said he is optimistic that it will be functional again soon.

title: UP Man Shot Dead During Marriage Procession Over Alleged Affair
content: A 32-year-old man, who came to attend a marriage function in Shahjahanpur district, has been shot dead over an alleged affair.

title: Gujarat Man Arrested For Spying For Pak, Shared Key Info On Air Force
content: A man in Gujarat has been arrested for allegedly sharing key information related to the Indian Air Force (IAF) and the Border Security Force (BSF) with a Pakistani agent, officials said on Saturday.

title: Chellanam residents cry for help as sea surge makes life miserable
content: Around 200 homes faced danger in places like Kannamaly, Cheriakadavu, and Puthenthode amid the first spell of rains

title: Maharashtra civic polls: SEC nudges State Government to begin delimitation; Mumbai, Pune municipal elections to held soon
content: Twenty-nine municipal corporations have been run by administrators as their terms expired in the past three years

title: Orange alert: Dharwad district sets up helpline
content: With orange alert being sounded for Dharwad district, the administration has taken all precautionary measures to address any contingency and has also set up helplines for the purpose.

title: Kozhikode gets official flower, bird, animal and tree
content: It follows constitution of expert committees and studies by biodiversity management committees at the local level which collected opinion from the people

title: Kerala requisitions Centre for nine NDRF teams, given the intensifying monsoon
content: Government hopes to position them strategically across the State along with the police, and fire and rescue departments, revenue teams and voluntary rescue forces

title: Rain, strong winds in Western Ghats disrupt power supply, damage crops in southern districts
content: The well-marked low pressure area over east-central Arabian Sea, off the South Konkan coast, has intensified into a depression; rain lashes Kanniyakumari, Tirunelveli and Tenkasi districts

title: National Farmers’ Party launched in Kottayam, banking on Catholic electorate’s support
content: The Kerala Farmers’ Federation’s political outfit is hoping to ride on rural discontent and agricultural concerns. Former Kanjirappally MLA George J. Mathew will serve as the party chairman.

title: Carry on, it says cheerfully, all the while preparing to die
content: Kurt Vonnegut dismissed the semicolon as a “transvestite hermaphrodite representing absolutely nothing”

title: CISF celebrates silver jubilee of induction at Kochi airport
content: Over the years,the unit has handled numerous challenges and critical situations ensuring smooth and secure functioning of the airport

title: Pakistan put in abeyance principles guiding Indus Waters Treaty: MEA
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri says that it is concluded in a “spirit of goodwill, and friendship” and all these principles have in effect been held in abeyance by Pakistan

title: BJP national secretary chairs meeting with district presidents
content: Addressing the gathering, BJP national general secretary (organisation) B.L. Santhosh stresses the importance of strengthening the organisation at the grassroots level

title: No need to panic but stay alert: TG Health Dept. on COVID-19 situation
content: Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare has not issued any new advisory or guidelines, attributing this to the nature of the outbreak

title: Ramesh's tendency to stir controversies harming Congress: BJP on his remarks on NITI Aayog meeting
content: This is a meeting of Team India to take decisions for the country's development. Jairam Ramesh is finding fault in this too, says BJP national spokesperson Syed Shahnawaz Hussain

title: As monsoon gathers strength, check-dam poses landslip threat on Chokaramudi hills
content: Local people have been demanding the demolition of the check-dam set up on an encroached property. The land was reclaimed by the government, but the check-dam is yet to be demolished.

title: Madras High Court judge lauds the services of DLSA, lists its welfare activities in Thoothukudi
content: Many cases are being taken up through DLSA and lawyers appearing for DSLA do not charge any fee for these appearances, says R. Subramanian, Judge, Madras High Court

title: Heavy rain and squally winds leave a trail of destruction in Central Travancore
content: Severe damage has been reported from the eastern parts of Kottayam district, including Thalanad, Pala, and Erattupetta

title: BRS flays Centre’s decision to fund A.P.’s Polavaram-Banakacherla Link Project
content: Party leader Harish Rao says it was being taken up without any permissions and clearances; accuses Centre of meting step-motherly treatment to Telangana in case of FRBM limit for irrigation projects

title: TTD adopting technology in providing enhanced services to devotees, says EO Syamala Rao
content: A WhatsApp-based feedback system has also been introduced to gather real-time suggestions from devotees, he says

title: Historian calls for restoration of ancient Mallela Gutta hillock temples of Vijayanagara era
content: Formal representation submitted to the Department of Tourism, Archaeology, and Culture, seeking the reconstruction of these historically significant structures, says MyNaa Swamy

title: LDF government’s self-congratulatory progress report cannot fool people: Satheesan
content: He demands a comprehensive investigation into allegations of corruption in the construction of NH 66, along with inquiries into lapses in engineering supervision and the questionable awarding of sub-contracts.

title: Revised procedures issued for metering and billing of electric vehicle charging stations equipped with solar power units
content: As per the revised procedures, new time zone-based billing is to be implemented for the charging stations

title: KSDMA issues alert of potentially dangerous cargo fallen from a ship off Kochi coast
content: The alert also warns about a potential oil spill along the shore probably between central and northern Kerala. KSDMA issued the alert based on the information shared by the Indian Coast Guard

title: Government ratifies employees’ provident fund interest rate at 8.25% for FY25
content: This decision was taken at the 237th meeting of the Central Board of Trustees of the EPFO, chaired by Union Minister for Labour & Employment Mansukh Mandaviya on February 28

title: Haryana High Court Chief Justice withdraws case from judge after getting 'oral, written' complaints
content: “In the attending factual scenario, if the Chief Justice had not taken preventive emergent steps, then the Chief Justice would be failing in his duty and belying the oath taken by him

title: Kisan drones will be extensively used in kharif season in Srikakulam district, says Collector
content: ‘Proper use of drones will avoid excess use of fertilizers, pesticides and minimise financial burden on farmers’

title: Southwest monsoon sets in over Kerala, triggering vigorous spells
content: Kumarakom in Kottayam recorded the highest rainfall of 12 cm during the past 24 hours ending at 8.30 a.m. on Saturday. This is the earliest date of monsoon onset over Kerala after 2009, when it set in over the State on May 23.  Red alert for five districts from Malappuram to Kasaragod  on Sunday

title: KSRTC cracks down on breakdowns in wilderness
content: New protocol implemented to ensure the roadworthiness of vehicles deployed under its Budget Tourism Cell

title: Revanth Reddy shares Telangana’s role in $30 trillion Indian economy by 2047 at NITI Aayog meeting
content: The State’s Chief Minister presents “Telangana Rising 2047” as an aspirational contribution to Viksit Bharat and explains Telangana’s resolve to be among the first states to achieve a $1 trillion economy

title: Floating house offers flood-resilient living in Kuttanad
content: The structure is anchored on a 1.2-m-high foundation made from a combination of ferrocement and thermocol. Inside this hollow base are 110 vacuum chambers, which enable buoyancy during floods.

title: Four killed, three injured in a road accident near Kadapa
content: The accident took place on the Rayachoti-Kadapa stretch of National Highway-40 when a speeding truck hit a car from behind

title: A.P. government mandates procurement of Burley tobacco at ₹12,000 per quintal
content: Minister for Agriculture Kinjarapu Atchannaidu, after a meeting at the camp office of Parchur MLA Yeluri Sambasiva Rao, directed the companies to start purchasing the produce from Sunday

title: Religious leader held under POCSO charges
content: The victim is the daughter of a devotee. Her family took her to the Mutt as some family members believed their illness could be cured by the swami

title: Move to shut Vellarakkad halt station draws passengers’ protest
content: Local passengers say the decision will double the travelling expenses of many who relied on the local train service

title: Miss England quits Miss World 2025 midway citing ethical concerns
content: A British tabloid claimed contestants were allegedly asked to “socialise with middle-aged men”, which the organisers have termed “baseless and completely fabricated”.

title: Is this the endgame for the Maoists?
content: Since the formation of CPI (Maoist) in 2004, the focus has been on developing the military wing and the political wing was grossly neglected.

title: Leader of Opposition Atishi claims water crisis in Delhi, seeks urgent meeting with CM Gupta
content: Delhi faces a water crisis as Leader of Opposition Atishi criticizes the BJP for disrupted supplies, urging immediate action from government

title: Plea in Madhya Pradesh High Court over ‘communal’ media coverage of Bhopal rape case
content: Petitioner seeks action against two Hindi dailies for invoking “love jihad” and defaming Muslim community; urges safeguards against divisive reportage

title: Gujarat man arrested for sharing sensitive info with Pakistani spy
content: Since June 2023, Gohil, a resident of Lakhpat taluka of Kutch, had shared photos and videos of various BSF and naval facilities in Kutch district via WhatsApp with the Pakistani spy for money

title: KTR’s allegations against Revanth indicate his nervousness over Kavitha’s letter: Congress
content: Congress leaders Mahesh Kumar Goud and Ponnam Prabhakar accuse KTR of diverting attention from family controversy

title: BBMP chief engineer Prahlad moves to B-SMILE as Director (Technical)
content: The latest order noted that the SPV urgently required the post of full-time director (technical), and hence, the merger

title: LIC bags Guinness world record for selling highest life insurance policies in 24 hours
content: LIC India earns Guinness World Record for most life insurance policies sold in 24 hours, showcasing agent productivity

title: Three police constables in an inebriated mood run riot in Tirumala; suspended
content: In a glaring lapse of protocol, security at the Alipiri checkpoint failed to inspect the vehicle with the drunken constables due to its police markings

title: Pawar, Thackeray brands cannot be wiped out from Maharashtra politics: Raj
content: Raj Thackeray's comments come amid a buzz about his possible reconciliation with his cousin Shiv Sena (UBT) president Uddhav Thackeray, nearly two decades after parting ways

title: Coverts are there in every party, says KTR in response to Kavitha’s letter episode
content: Mr. Rama Rao said there was democracy in BRS and they encouraged open culture as part of which any party leader or activist could write letters to the party president

title: At least three shot dead, two injured in clash between groups in Bihar
content: The clash broke out around 5 a.m. between the groups in Ahiyapur village under the jurisdiction of the Rajpur Police Station

title: SIT begins probe into Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah’s controversial comments
content: Sagar Zone Inspector General of Police Pramod Verma heads the SIT, while Special Armed Forces DIG Kalyan Chakrvarthy and Dindori Superintendent of Police Vahini Singh are its other members

title: KTR demands Revanth Reddy’s resignation for his ‘involvement’ in National Herald case
content: He questions the silence of Telangana BJP in the matter, when Karnataka BJP leaders are demanding resignation of D.K. Shivakumar for his similar role in the ED case

title: Three killed of electric shock in Vijayawada
content: Three electrocuted in Vijayawada colony, including S. Durga Prasada Rao, his wife Mutyalamma, and sister Hema Vani

title: ‘Ayogya body’: Congress slams NITI Aayog meeting as exercise in ‘hypocrisy’, ‘diversion’
content: Party leader Jairam Ramesh criticises NITI Aayog meeting chaired by PM Modi, questioning BJP-led Government’s vision for Viksit Bharat

title: Puducherrry CM Rangasamy skips NITI Aayog meeting once again
content: Puducherry CM Rangasamy, who also holds the Finance portfolio, has not given any reason for abstaining from the  NITI Aayog meeting meeting

title: Anjaneyulu, Vallabhaneni Vamsi shifted to hospital after suffering illness
content: Sitarama Anjaneyulu was in jail in APPSC job scam, while Vamsi was in police custody in fake house site pattas case

title: Police raid central prison in Bengaluru, recover banned items from inmates despite multi level security checks
content: A complaint has been filed with the Parappana Agarahara police in this regard based on which the prison officials of the central prison

title: 'Like Team India': PM Modi bats for Centre-state cooperation at Niti Aayog meet
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasised Centre-state collaboration for achieving 'Viksit Bharat@2047' during the NITI Aayog meeting, urging states to develop world-class tourist destinations and future-ready cities. Andhra Pradesh CM proposed sub-groups focusing on GDP growth, population management, and technology-based governance. Several CMs, including those from West Bengal, Kerala and Puducherry, were absent from the meeting.

title: 'Unity needed to avoid authoritarianism': B'desh govt fears uncertain future
content: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Muhammad Yunus, faces mounting pressure as rival parties protest, demanding early elections. The government assures democratic reforms before the scheduled 2026 elections, while accusing critics of hindering its progress with unreasonable demands. Concerns rise about potential military intervention, reminiscent of a past crisis, as the army chief supports the opposition's call for elections by December.

title: 'Pak put in abeyance goodwill ...': MEA on why India suspended Indus Treaty
content: India has justified its decision to suspend the Indus Waters Treaty, citing Pakistan's violation of the agreement's principles following the Pahalgam terror attack. The Ministry of External Affairs highlighted Pakistan's disregard for goodwill and friendship, coupled with cross-border terrorism hindering India's treaty exploitation. Shifts in ground realities, including climate change and engineering advancements, necessitate renegotiation for the 21st century.

title: From anxiety to fatigue: How climate change is affecting mental health
content: Climate change is not only causing environmental damage but also significantly impacting mental health, leading to eco-anxiety and ecological grief, especially among younger generations. Experts emphasize the need for integrated care models and increased awareness to address climate-related distress. Recognizing eco-anxiety as a valid concern and promoting emotional resilience are crucial for holistic climate action.

title: Microsoft software engineer fired for disrupting CEO's speech at Build 2025
content: Microsoft fired a software engineer, Joe Lopez, for disrupting CEO Satya Nadella's keynote at Build 2025, protesting the company's partnership with the Israeli military. Lopez accused Microsoft of complicity in harming Palestinians through its Azure cloud services.

title: ‘Yachna nahin ...’: How Army delivered bold message post Op Sindoor
content: Following the Pahalgam massacre, Indian armed forces executed Operation Sindoor, decimating nine terrorist hotspots in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. The operation, named by Prime Minister Modi, showcased India's military prowess through videos set to powerful music and verses. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised the operation's swift dismantling of terrorist infrastructure in just 23 minutes.

title: 'Harming Cong': BJP slams Jairam Ramesh's 6 posers on Niti Aayog meet
content: BJP criticised Jairam Ramesh for calling NITI Aayog an "Ayogya" body, claiming such remarks would harm the Congress. Syed Shahnawaz Hussain emphasised NITI Aayog's role in national development, highlighting the participation of chief ministers and eminent individuals in policy-making. He also criticised Rahul Gandhi's delayed visit to Kashmir and his alleged political activities in Bihar.

title: Who is Vaniya Agarwal, Indian engineer who protested Microsoft CEO twice
content: Vaniya Agrawal, an Indian-American software engineer, protested Microsoft's ties with the Israeli government. She disrupted two major Microsoft events. Agrawal questioned the company's cloud contracts. She was later fired by Microsoft after the first protest. Agrawal previously worked at Amazon. She also ran a small business. She is now sharing videos of her protests on social media.

title: Shubman Gill: A generational talent to lead India's NextGen in Test cricket
content: The sudden Test retirements of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma left a big leadership vacuum in the Indian cricket team and the selectors have backed Shubman Gill for the job. The 25-year-old has led India in five T20Is, Punjab and India A in a handful of matches, and has also been leading Gujarat Titans for the past two seasons. The leadership challenge in the whites is going to be a different ball game, though, and Gill will have his task cut out during the English summer. Those who have seen him grow, evolve, learn and dominate from U-16 days feel he is the right choice!

title: Woman who avoided sunlight...: Signs of dangerous Vitamin D deficiency
content: A 48-year-old Chinese woman suffered a fracture while turning in bed due to severe osteoporosis, stemming from lifelong sun avoidance. Her fear of tanning led to critically low Vitamin D levels, hindering calcium absorption and weakening her bones. This case highlights the importance of sunlight for Vitamin D synthesis and bone health, cautioning against extreme sun protection measures.

title: Just 17 days after meeting 'Danish', YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra travelled to Pakistan
content: Travel blogger Jyoti Malhotra, known as Travel with Joe, faces espionage charges for Pakistan, raising concerns due to her extensive international travel. Records show visits to Dubai, Kathmandu, and Kashmir in January, followed by Pakistan in March and Indonesia in May.

title: Twitter not working for you: This could be the reason why
content: X, formerly Twitter, experienced its second major outage in a week, impacting users globally. Reports indicate issues with app access, website functionality, and direct messaging. The company acknowledged a data center outage and is working on a solution. Users have expressed frustration online, reporting problems with timeline loading and DM functionality.

title: Pipe assault, rat poison suicide bid: Chilling details of Hagawane death case
content: Rajendra Hagawane, an expelled NCP functionary, and his son Sushil were apprehended in Swargate after a week-long search following the alleged suicide of Vaishnavi Hagawane. Police teams had been actively pursuing them since the incident on May 16 in Bhukum. A court has remanded both into custody until May 28 for further investigation.

title: ‘Whitewashing terrorism’: BJP slams Rahul for calling Pak shelling a 'tragedy'
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's description of the Poonch attack as a "tragedy," accusing him of downplaying terrorism. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged Gandhi was "whitewashing" Pakistan's actions and providing them "cover fire." Gandhi, during his visit to Poonch, met with affected families, expressing his commitment to raising their concerns nationally after the cross-border shelling.

title: Gujarat ATS arrests man for sharing sensitive info with Pakistani spy
content: In Gujarat's Kutch district, the Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) apprehended Sahdevsinh Gohil, a contractual health worker, for allegedly sharing sensitive information about Indian military establishments with a Pakistani spy. Gohil, lured by an agent posing as Aditi Bharadwaj, reportedly sent photos and videos of BSF and Indian Navy facilities via WhatsApp in exchange for money.

title: 'Broken homes, moist eyes': Rahul Gandhi visits Pak shelling-hit Poonch in J&K
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited Poonch, J&K, to meet civilians affected by cross-border shelling from Pakistan. He assured residents he would raise their concerns nationally, emphasizing the strength and dignity they displayed amidst the conflict. Gandhi also visited a school and a damaged Gurudwara, encouraging students and expressing solidarity. The J&K government has announced compensation for the affected families.

title: Watch: NASA's Curiosity rover sends immersive landscape’s video of Mars
content: NASA's Curiosity rover has captured a stunning panoramic video from Mars, revealing an Earth-like landscape within Gale Crater. The rover is currently exploring a sulfate-rich region, offering insights into Mars' past when water was abundant. Curiosity's journey, spanning over 352 million miles, recently uncovered pure elemental sulfur, sparking further questions about the planet's potential for past life.

title: After emergency talks, Yunus to stay on as B'desh interim chief: Report
content: Amidst political turmoil and military pressure, Bangladesh's interim chief Muhammad Yunus will remain in office, confirmed by his advisers after a closed-door meeting. Despite considering resignation due to rising tensions and demands for election clarity, Yunus is set to meet with BNP and Jamaat-e-Islami leaders.

title: Karun Nair's emotional Test return after nearly 3000 days
content: After a hiatus of over 3000 days, Karun Nair makes a remarkable return to India's Test squad for the upcoming series against England. Despite a prolific domestic season and a historic triple century in 2016, Nair faced prolonged exclusion.  The right-hander was prolific in the 2024–25 domestic season, scoring 863 runs in nine Ranji Trophy matches with four centuries, and 779 runs in eight Vijay Hazare Trophy innings, including five centuries.

title: Travis Kelce shocks Taylor Swift with £80,000 presents after time spent apart
content: Despite their demanding schedules and geographical distance, Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce maintain a strong bond. Kelce reportedly spent £80,000 on designer gifts for Swift, including Balenciaga outfits, Louis Vuitton jackets, and Hermès beach bags, ensuring she feels cherished. Sources indicate Kelce's generosity and attention to Swift's style demonstrate their commitment, fueling speculation about their future together.

title: Shreyas Iyer ignored for Tests; Agarkar says 'there's no room for him'
content: Shubman Gill is named captain for the England tour, marking a transitional phase for the Indian Test team, with Rishabh Pant as his deputy. Karun Nair makes a comeback after eight years, while Shreyas Iyer is excluded. B Sai Sudharsan and Arshdeep Singh receive their first Test call-ups. The five-match series against England starts on June 20.

title: 'Suffered skull fracture': Man assaulted by delivery boy; Zepto replies
content: In Bengaluru, a businessman named Shashank S. has accused a Zepto delivery agent, Vishnuvardhan, of physical assault following a dispute over a mismatched delivery address. The incident escalated when Shashank intervened in an argument between the delivery agent and his sister-in-law, resulting in the agent allegedly punching him and causing a skull fracture.

title: Mamata, Vijayan among absent opposition CMs as PM Modi chairs NITI Aayog meet
content: Several opposition-ruled states' chief ministers, including West Bengal, Kerala, Karnataka, and Puducherry, were absent from the Niti Aayog's 10th Governing Council meeting chaired by Prime Minister Modi. The meeting focused on "Viksit Rajya for Viksit Bharat @2047," with Modi emphasizing Centre-state cooperation to achieve national goals and urging states to develop world-class tourist destinations.

title: PM Modi likely to meet kin of Pahalgam attack victim Shubham Dwivedi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to meet the family of Shubham Dwivedi, killed in the Pahalgam terror attack, during his Kanpur visit on May 30, following a request from MP Ramesh Awasthi. The family seeks martyr status for Shubham, who was tragically killed in the attack. They hope the Prime Minister will grant their request, honouring Shubham's memory.

title: IMF in 'constructive discussions' with Pakistan, next review expected soon
content: The IMF is in talks with Pakistan regarding its FY2025-26 budget and economic reforms, aiming for continued support under existing loan arrangements. Discussions focus on revenue enhancement, energy sector reforms, and maintaining a tight monetary policy to control inflation. The IMF emphasizes rebuilding foreign exchange reserves and a flexible exchange rate.

title: BSF foils infiltration attempt in Gujarat, Pakistani intruder neutralised
content: Border Security Force (BSF) successfully neutralized a Pakistani intruder attempting to infiltrate Indian territory in Gujarat's Banaskantha district on Friday night. The intruder disregarded warnings and continued advancing towards the border fence, prompting BSF troops to open fire. This incident occurred amidst heightened security following Pakistan's cross-border activities, including India's Operation Sindoor targeting terror camps.

title: Why Jasprit Bumrah was overlooked for Team India Test captaincy
content: Shubman Gill will lead the Indian cricket team as captain for the upcoming Test series in England. Rishabh Pant has been appointed as the vice-captain. The squad of 18 members was announced by Ajit Agarkar. Jasprit Bumrah may not play all five Tests. India aims to win their first Test series in England since 2007.

title: KEA Karnataka KCET result 2025 out: List of official websites to check results
content: The Karnataka Examinations Authority (KEA) has announced the KCET 2025 results on May 24. Over 3.3 lakh candidates appeared for the exam. Scorecards will be available from 2 PM on cetonline.karnataka.gov.in/kea and karresults.nic.in. Counselling is expected to begin in June, involving registration, choice filling, seat allotment, and document verification.

title: 'Don’t want to hear...': NBA Analyst Stephen A. Smith backs NFL's Ryan Clark
content: Stephen A. Smith, an ESPN analyst, addressed the public dispute involving Ryan Clark and Robert Griffin III. The disagreement stemmed from Griffin III's comments on WNBA players Angel Reese and Caitlin Clark. Clark criticized Griffin III, leading to personal attacks. Smith defended Clark, stating that firing him would be unwarranted.

title: Muslim man seen offering namaz at Tirumala sparks row in Andhra Pradesh
content: A video showing a Muslim driver offering namaz in Tirumala, a Hindu pilgrimage town, has sparked controversy. The incident, which occurred near the Purohita Sangham area, has drawn criticism for allegedly violating rules prohibiting non-Hindu religious practices on the Tirumala hills.

title: 'Had conversations with Virat and Rohit': Agarkar breaks silence
content: Ajit Agarkar acknowledges a significant shift in the Indian Test team. Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Ravichandran Ashwin's absence creates a void. Shubman Gill is named captain for the England series. Rishabh Pant will be the vice-captain. Kohli communicated his decision in early April. The team is looking forward to the new World Test Championship cycle.

title: Shubman Gill named India's new Test captain ahead of England tour
content: Shubman Gill, 25, has been appointed as India's Test captain, succeeding Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The BCCI announced a new-look squad for the upcoming five-match Test series against England, starting June 20. Gill, who has captaincy experience in T20Is and the IPL, will lead India in the ICC World Test Championship 2025–27 cycle, beginning with the England tour.

title: Noida reports 1st Covid case as woman tests positive after train journey
content: A 55-year-old woman in Noida has tested positive for Covid-19 and is currently under home quarantine, according to officials. The woman had travelled by train on May 14th. Samples from her family members have been collected for testing.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks shut on May 24, what RBI calender says
content: Banks nationwide are closed today, May 24th, for the fourth Saturday of the month, as per RBI guidelines. While physical branch services are unavailable, digital banking options like mobile apps, ATMs, and online payment systems remain operational for uninterrupted transactions.

title: Monsoon arrives early: Kerala receives first showers 8 days ahead of schedule
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) declared the arrival of the southwest monsoon over Kerala on Saturday, marking its earliest onset since 2009, reaching eight days ahead of schedule. While the timing of the monsoon's arrival in Kerala varies annually, meteorologists emphasize that it doesn't directly influence the total rainfall or its distribution across India.

title: Why Apple may choose to stay for 'Make in India' iPhones even after 25% tariff
content: The Global Trade Research Initiative suggests that manufacturing iPhones in India remains financially advantageous for Apple, even with a potential 25% US tariff. Lower labor costs in India, around $230 per month compared to $2,900 in the US, significantly reduce assembly expenses.

title: Explained: Why Rajat Patidar faced a heavier fine than Pat Cummins
content: Rajat Patidar and Pat Cummins faced fines for slow over-rates during their IPL match, with Patidar incurring a heavier penalty of Rs 24 lakh due to RCB's repeat offence. Cummins was fined Rs 12 lakh for SRH's first violation. The match saw SRH defeat RCB by 42 runs, as the IPL emphasizes over-rate penalties to maintain the pace of play.

title: 3 childhood friends die in high-speed SUV crash on Bhopal-Indore highway
content: In a tragic incident on the Bhopal-Indore Highway, three childhood friends, Pankaj Sisodia, Preet Ahuja, and Vishal Dabi, lost their lives when their speeding SUV crashed into a tree and electric pole. Rahul Kanade, the fourth friend, is critically injured and receiving treatment.

title: 'No credentials to speak about protecting civilians': India rips into Pakistan at UN
content: India strongly criticized Pakistan at the UN Security Council for its hypocritical stance on civilian protection, citing Pakistan's support for terrorists and recent attacks on Indian civilians and religious sites. India highlighted Operation Sindoor, launched in response to a terror attack, and accused Pakistan of cross-border shelling that severely damaged border communities in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: 'India will never give in to nuclear blackmail, will engage Pak bilaterally': Jaishankar
content: During his Berlin visit, external affairs minister Jaishankar firmly condemned the Pahalgam terror attack, asserting India's zero-tolerance stance on terrorism and its resolve against nuclear blackmail. He emphasised that all issues with Pakistan would be handled bilaterally, excluding third-party involvement. Discussions with German leaders focused on strengthening the India-Germany partnership, with Germany expressing support for India's right to self-defense.

title: Build in US, not India, or pay tariffs: Trump’s ultimatum to Apple
content: Donald Trump warned Apple that if it builds factories in India, the company will face tariffs when selling its products in the United States. Trump threatened a 25 per cent tariff on smartphones made outside the US, extending the warning to other manufacturers like Samsung. He said his expectation that iPhones sold in America should be manufactured domestically.

title: Why the Colorado Rockies are every bookmaker's nightmare
content: the Colorado Rockies have the worst 50-game start in the majors since 1895 . a winning percentage puts them on pace to win only 26 games and lose 136 . bettors are fading the 2025 Rockies and avoiding backing them at all costs .

title: How playoff pressure is different for Seth Jones, other Panthers without a ring
content: a 4-0 lead gives the Panthers the lead going into the third period . Nate Schmidt is one of seven Panthers on the playoff roster . most of them won the Stanley Cup for the first time in franchise history . he says he doesn't want to be the guy without a one-year free agent .

title: Oilers make a statement with 3-0 win in Game 2: Grades, takeaways for both teams
content: the Edmonton Oilers beat the Dallas Stars 3-0 to tie the series at 1-1 . Stuart Skinner continued to be the most boom-or-bust player in the postseason . he gave up 20 goals and didn't have a save percentage better than .833 .

title: What we like and don't like about the CFP seeding change
content: conference commissioners voted to go to a straight seeding format in 2025 . there are plenty of things to discuss regarding what the CFP will look like in 2026 and beyond . the 2025 season starting in less than 100 days, we at least know how things take shape this fall .

title: Mets, Dodgers prepare for high-stakes NL matchup
content: the defending world series champions play three games this weekend at Citi Field . the team they beat to win the national league pennant last fall play four games at Dodger Stadium starting June 2 . both teams enter back-and-forth battles for first place in their respective divisions .

title: De Bruyne, Sané, Messi, Ronaldo among top free agents in 2025
content: the list of high-profile players whose contracts expire in 2025 is pretty impressive . there are some big names whose futures are not yet resolved . some are working on deals to find a new club behind the scenes . others have agreed their next move before they have even finished playing .
